query.sql: select replace(q.SQL_FULLTEXT,chr(0)) sql_text from v$session s,v$sql q where s.sql_address = q.address and s.sql_hash_value = q.hash_value and s.sid = :SID

SELECT plan_hash_value,LPAD(' ',4*(DEPTH-1))||operation||' '||options ||' '||object_name ||' '||DECODE(id, 0, 'Cost = '||position) "Query Plan",lpad( CASE WHEN cardinality > 1000000 THEN to_char(trunc(cardinality/1000000)) || 'M' WHEN cardinality > 1000 THEN to_char(trunc(cardinality/1000)) || 'K' ELSE cardinality || ' ' END , 6 , ' ' ) AS "Rows" -- nvl(entries,0) as "Rowsource Time" FROM v$sql_plan sp /*,(select sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_plan_line_id, sql_plan_hash_value, count(*) entries from v$active_session_history where sql_id = :SQL_ID and sql_exec_id = (select sql_exec_id from v$active_session_history where sql_id = :SQL_ID and rownum=1) group by sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_plan_line_id, sql_plan_hash_value ) ash WHERE sp.sql_id = :SQL_ID AND ash.sql_id(+) = sp.sql_id AND ash.sql_plan_line_id(+)= sp.id ORDER by sp.plan_hash_value, sp.id */ WHERE sp.sql_id = :SQL_ID order by sp.plan_hash_value,sp.child_address,sp.id

SELECT LPAD(' ',4*(DEPTH-1))||operation||' '||options ||' '||object_name ||' '||DECODE(id, 0, 'Cost = '||position) "Query Plan",lpad( CASE WHEN cardinality > 1000000 THEN to_char(trunc(cardinality/1000000)) || 'M' WHEN cardinality > 1000 THEN to_char(trunc(cardinality/1000)) || 'K' ELSE cardinality || ' ' END , 6 , ' ' ) AS "Rows", nvl(entries,0) as "Rowsource Time(s)" FROM v$sql_plan sp,(select sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_plan_line_id, sql_plan_hash_value, count(*) entries from v$active_session_history where sql_id = :SQL_ID and sql_exec_id = (select sql_exec_id from v$active_session_history where sql_id = :SQL_ID and rownum=1) group by sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_plan_line_id, sql_plan_hash_value ) ash WHERE sp.sql_id = :SQL_ID AND ash.sql_id(+) = sp.sql_id AND ash.sql_plan_line_id(+)= sp.id ORDER by sp.plan_hash_value, sp.id
select event,p1,p2, case when p3 = 0 then null else p3 end p3 from v$session_wait where sid = :SID
select s.SID,s.status,s.username,s.process,s.LOGON_TIME, s.logon_time since,s.server,s.type,p.spid,p.TRACEID, s.serial# from v$session s, v$process p where sid = :SID and s.paddr = p.addr
select osuser,machine,terminal,CLIENT_INFO,CLIENT_IDENTIFIER from v$session where sid = :SID

select decode(command, 0,null, 1,'CRE TAB', 2,'INSERT', 3,'SELECT', 4,'CRE CLUSTER', 5,'ALT CLUSTER', 6,'UPDATE', 7,'DELETE', 8,'DRP CLUSTER', 9,'CRE INDEX', 10,'DROP INDEX', 11,'ALT INDEX', 12,'DROP TABLE', 13,'CRE SEQ', 14,'ALT SEQ', 15,'ALT TABLE', 16,'DROP SEQ', 17,'GRANT', 18,'REVOKE', 19,'CRE SYN', 20,'DROP SYN', 21,'CRE VIEW', 22,'DROP VIEW', 23,'VAL INDEX', 24,'CRE PROC', 25,'ALT PROC', 26,'LOCK TABLE', 28,'RENAME', 29,'COMMENT', 30,'AUDIT', 31,'NOAUDIT', 32,'CRE DBLINK', 33,'DROP DBLINK', 34,'CRE DB', 35,'ALTER DB', 36,'CRE RBS', 37,'ALT RBS', 38,'DROP RBS', 39,'CRE TBLSPC', 40,'ALT TBLSPC', 41,'DROP TBLSPC', 42,'ALT SESSION', 43,'ALT USER', 44,'COMMIT', 45,'ROLLBACK', 46,'SAVEPOINT', 47,'PL/SQL EXEC', 48,'SET XACTN', 49,'SWITCH LOG', 50,'EXPLAIN', 51,'CRE USER', 52,'CRE ROLE', 53,'DROP USER', 54,'DROP ROLE', 55,'SET ROLE', 56,'CRE SCHEMA', 57,'CRE CTLFILE', 58,'ALTER TRACING', 59,'CRE TRIGGER', 60,'ALT TRIGGER', 61,'DRP TRIGGER', 62,'ANALYZE TAB', 63,'ANALYZE IX', 64,'ANALYZE CLUS', 65,'CRE PROFILE', 66,'DRP PROFILE', 67,'ALT PROFILE', 68,'DRP PROC', 69,'DRP PROC', 70,'ALT RESOURCE', 71,'CRE SNPLOG', 72,'ALT SNPLOG', 73,'DROP SNPLOG', 74,'CREATE SNAP', 75,'ALT SNAP', 76,'DROP SNAP', 79,'ALTER ROLE', 79,'ALTER ROLE', 85,'TRUNC TAB', 86,'TRUNC CLUST', 88,'ALT VIEW', 91,'CRE FUNC', 92,'ALT FUNC', 93,'DROP FUNC', 94,'CRE PKG', 95,'ALT PKG', 96,'DROP PKG', 97,'CRE PKG BODY', 98,'ALT PKG BODY', 99,'DRP PKG BODY', to_char(command)) "Command" ,LAST_CALL_ET,program,module,action from gv$session where sid = :SID

with locks as( select session_id,lock_type, mode_held,mode_requested,lock_id1,lock_id2,blocking_others from sys.dba_lock), waiters as ( select w.session_id waiting_session, h.session_id holding_session, w.lock_type lock_type, h.mode_held mode_held, w.mode_requested mode_requested, w.lock_id1, w.lock_id2 from locks w, locks h where h.blocking_others = 'Blocking' and h.mode_held != 'None' and h.mode_held != 'Null' and w.mode_requested != 'None' and w.lock_type = h.lock_type and w.lock_id1 = h.lock_id1 and w.lock_id2 = h.lock_id2 and (w.session_id = :SID or h.session_id = :SID)), blockers as( select holding_session waiting_session, to_number(null) holding_session, 'None' lock_type, null mode_held, null mode_requested, null lock_id1, null lock_id2 from waiters minus select waiting_session waiting_session, to_number(null) holding_session, 'None' lock_type, null mode_held, null mode_requested, null lock_id1, null lock_id2 from waiters), waiters_blockers as( select waiting_session,holding_session,lock_type,mode_held,mode_requested,lock_id1,lock_id2 from waiters union all select waiting_session,holding_session,lock_type,mode_held,mode_requested,lock_id1,lock_id2 from blockers), lock_objects as( select session_id,cnt lock_obj_count, case when cnt = 1 then object_name else null end object_name, object_id,owner,object_type from( select session_id,count(distinct object_name) cnt,max(object_name) object_name, max(lo.object_id) object_id, max(ao.owner) owner,max(object_type) object_type from gv$locked_object lo,all_objects ao,waiters_blockers wb where lo.object_id = ao.object_id and (wb.waiting_session = lo.session_id or wb.holding_session = lo.session_id) group by session_id)), wait_block_ses as( select waiting_session,holding_session,lock_type,mode_held,mode_requested, s.username,s.osuser,s.CLIENT_INFO,s.CLIENT_IDENTIFIER,o.object_name,o.owner,o.object_id,module,o.object_type,o.lock_obj_count, decode(s.command, 0,null, 1,'CRE TAB', 2,'INSERT', 3,'SELECT', 4,'CRE CLUSTER', 5,'ALT CLUSTER', 6,'UPDATE', 7,'DELETE', 8,'DRP CLUSTER', 9,'CRE INDEX', 10,'DROP INDEX', 11,'ALT INDEX', 12,'DROP TABLE', 13,'CRE SEQ', 14,'ALT SEQ', 15,'ALT TABLE', 16,'DROP SEQ', 17,'GRANT', 18,'REVOKE', 19,'CRE SYN', 20,'DROP SYN', 21,'CRE VIEW', 22,'DROP VIEW', 23,'VAL INDEX', 24,'CRE PROC', 25,'ALT PROC', 26,'LOCK TABLE', 28,'RENAME', 29,'COMMENT', 30,'AUDIT', 31,'NOAUDIT', 32,'CRE DBLINK', 33,'DROP DBLINK', 34,'CRE DB', 35,'ALTER DB', 36,'CRE RBS', 37,'ALT RBS', 38,'DROP RBS', 39,'CRE TBLSPC', 40,'ALT TBLSPC', 41,'DROP TBLSPC', 42,'ALT SESSION', 43,'ALT USER', 44,'COMMIT', 45,'ROLLBACK', 46,'SAVEPOINT', 47,'PL/SQL EXEC', 48,'SET XACTN', 49,'SWITCH LOG', 50,'EXPLAIN', 51,'CRE USER', 52,'CRE ROLE', 53,'DROP USER', 54,'DROP ROLE', 55,'SET ROLE', 56,'CRE SCHEMA', 57,'CRE CTLFILE', 58,'ALTER TRACING', 59,'CRE TRIGGER', 60,'ALT TRIGGER', 61,'DRP TRIGGER', 62,'ANALYZE TAB', 63,'ANALYZE IX', 64,'ANALYZE CLUS', 65,'CRE PROFILE', 66,'DRP PROFILE', 67,'ALT PROFILE', 68,'DRP PROC', 69,'DRP PROC', 70,'ALT RESOURCE', 71,'CRE SNPLOG', 72,'ALT SNPLOG', 73,'DROP SNPLOG', 74,'CREATE SNAP', 75,'ALT SNAP', 76,'DROP SNAP', 79,'ALTER ROLE', 79,'ALTER ROLE', 85,'TRUNC TAB', 86,'TRUNC CLUST', 88,'ALT VIEW', 91,'CRE FUNC', 92,'ALT FUNC', 93,'DROP FUNC', 94,'CRE PKG', 95,'ALT PKG', 96,'DROP PKG', 97,'CRE PKG BODY', 98,'ALT PKG BODY', 99,'DRP PKG BODY', to_char(s.command)) command from waiters_blockers wb, v$session s, lock_objects o where s.sid = wb.waiting_session and o.session_id(+) = wb.waiting_session ) select case when holding_session is null then 'Lock' else 'Lock Waiting' end status, waiting_session, username, object_name, object_id,owner,object_type from wait_block_ses start with holding_session is null connect by prior waiting_session = holding_session

SELECT TRUNC(sl.elapsed_seconds/60) || ':' || MOD(sl.elapsed_seconds,60) elapsed, TRUNC(sl.time_remaining/60) || ':' || MOD(sl.time_remaining,60) remaining, ROUND(sl.sofar/sl.totalwork*100, 2) progress_pct FROM v$session_longops sl WHERE sql_id =:SQL_ID AND time_remaining > 0
SELECT 'ALTER SYSTEM KILL SESSION '''||v.SID||','||v.SERIAL#||''' IMMEDIATE;' as sql_st FROM V$SESSION v WHERE v.sid = :SID AND v.STATUS='ACTIVE'

-- temp space and memory usage SELECT s.sid,s.serial#, s.sql_id, operation_id, w.operation_type, ROUND(w.actual_mem_used/1024/1024,2) mem_mb, ROUND(w.tempseg_size /1024/1024,2) temp_mb, w.TABLESPACE temp_tbs FROM v$session s, v$sql_workarea_active w WHERE s.sid =w.sid AND TABLESPACE IS NOT NULL --and s.status='ACTIVE' and S.SID=:SID ORDER BY 1

display.name: ALM job status - 1 job all countries
display.description: Display Dispaly ALM batch job status - average of single job in 90 days

query.sql: -- max, min and average of last 30 days SELECT UPPER(trim(replace(:COUNTRYNAME,chr(120),''))), 'SCB_OBI_AGG_DATA_LOAD' FROM dual

display.name: Job Stats
display.description: Dispaly ALM batch job status - single job in 90 days

query.sql: WITH s0 AS ( SELECT etl_process_date ,etl_country_code ,etl_rd FROM scb_etl_log WHERE etl_rd >= sysdate - 10 AND etl_rd <= sysdate - 1 AND etl_msg_txt LIKE '[SCB_OBI_AGG_DATA_LOAD]Process Started at%' AND ( ( etl_country_code IN ( 'AE' ,'OM' ,'BH' ,'JO' ,'QA' ) AND trim(TO_CHAR(etl_rd, 'day', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = American')) NOT IN ('friday') ) OR ( etl_country_code IN ('BD') AND trim(TO_CHAR(etl_rd, 'day', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = American')) NOT IN ( 'friday' ,'saturday' ) ) OR ( etl_country_code IN ('NP') AND trim(TO_CHAR(etl_rd, 'day', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = American')) NOT IN ('saturday') ) OR ( etl_country_code IN ( 'JP' ,'KR' ,'MY' ,'SG' ,'CN' ,'HK' ,'TW' ,'PH' ,'BN' ,'ID' ,'TH' ,'VN' ,'NP' ,'IN' ,'LK' ,'PK' ,'KE' ,'BW' ,'ZA' ,'ZW' ,'NG' ,'EU' ,'GH' ,'US' ) AND trim(TO_CHAR(etl_rd, 'day', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = American')) NOT IN ( 'saturday' ,'sunday' ) ) ) --and etl_country_code='CN' AND etl_country_code = :COUNTRYNAME ) SELECT s1.etl_country_code ,s1.etl_rd ,s0.etl_process_date start_time ,s1.etl_process_date end_time , --s1.etl_process_date-s0.etl_process_date elapsed_mins, round((to_date(TO_CHAR(s1.etl_process_date, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi:ss'), 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi:ss') - to_date(TO_CHAR(s0.etl_process_date, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi:ss'), 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:mi:ss')) * 86400 / 60, 2) AS elapsed_mins FROM scb_etl_log s1 ,s0 WHERE s1.etl_rd >= sysdate - 10 AND s1.etl_rd <= sysdate - 1 AND s1.etl_msg_txt LIKE '[SCB_OBI_AGG_DATA_LOAD]: Process completed at%' AND s1.etl_country_code = :COUNTRYNAME AND s1.etl_country_code = s0.etl_country_code AND s1.etl_rd = s0.etl_rd AND ( ( s1.etl_country_code IN ( 'AE' ,'OM' ,'BH' ,'JO' ,'QA' ) AND trim(TO_CHAR(s1.etl_rd, 'day', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = American')) NOT IN ('friday') ) OR ( s1.etl_country_code IN ('BD') AND trim(TO_CHAR(s1.etl_rd, 'day', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = American')) NOT IN ( 'friday' ,'saturday' ) ) OR ( s1.etl_country_code IN ('NP') AND trim(TO_CHAR(s1.etl_rd, 'day', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = American')) NOT IN ('saturday') ) OR ( s1.etl_country_code IN ( 'JP' ,'KR' ,'MY' ,'SG' ,'CN' ,'HK' ,'TW' ,'PH' ,'BN' ,'ID' ,'TH' ,'VN' ,'NP' ,'IN' ,'LK' ,'PK' ,'KE' ,'BW' ,'ZA' ,'ZW' ,'NG' ,'EU' ,'GH' ,'US' ) AND trim(TO_CHAR(s1.etl_rd, 'day', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = American')) NOT IN ( 'saturday' ,'sunday' ) ) ) ORDER BY s1.etl_rd

SELECT TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) AS sn_time , lc1.metric_name , ROUND( lc1.average, 2 ) "Average" FROM sys.dba_hist_sysmetric_summary lc1 , sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn WHERE lc1.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND lc1.metric_id IN (2147, 2135) -- s. v$metricname AND lc1.dbid = sn.dbid AND lc1.instance_number = sn.instance_number AND lc1.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) and sn.begin_interval_time>sysdate -1 -- Limit snapshots to given list --AND sn.snap_id IN (&snapshotlist) -- Show only snapshots since last startup (avoid erroneous peaks in graph) --AND sn.startup_time = ( SELECT MAX(startup_time) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot ) UNION ALL SELECT TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) AS sn_time , 'CPU Count' , to_number(par.value) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn , sys.dba_hist_parameter par WHERE par.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND par.parameter_name = 'cpu_count' AND sn.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) and sn.begin_interval_time>sysdate -1 -- Limit snapshots to given list --AND sn.snap_id IN (&snapshotlist) -- Show only snapshots since last startup (avoid erroneous peaks in graph) --AND sn.startup_time = ( SELECT MAX(startup_time) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot ) ORDER BY 1, 2

SELECT TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) AS sn_time , CASE metric_id WHEN 2123 THEN 'Average Active Sessions' ELSE lc1.metric_name END metric_name , CASE metric_id WHEN 2123 THEN ROUND( lc1.average/100, 2 ) ELSE ROUND( lc1.average, 2 ) END "Average" FROM sys.dba_hist_sysmetric_summary lc1 , sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn WHERE lc1.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND lc1.metric_id IN (2123, 2135) -- s. v$metricname AND lc1.dbid = sn.dbid AND lc1.instance_number = sn.instance_number AND lc1.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) -- Limit snapshots to given list --AND sn.snap_id IN (&snapshotlist) -- Show only snapshots since last startup (avoid erroneous peaks in graph) --AND sn.startup_time = ( SELECT MAX(startup_time) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot ) UNION ALL SELECT TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) AS sn_time , 'CPU Count' , to_number(par.value) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn , sys.dba_hist_parameter par WHERE par.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND par.parameter_name = 'cpu_count' AND sn.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) -- Limit snapshots to given list --AND sn.snap_id IN (&snapshotlist) -- Show only snapshots since last startup (avoid erroneous peaks in graph) --AND sn.startup_time = ( SELECT MAX(startup_time) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot ) ORDER BY sn_time, metric_name

SELECT CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN 'SQL Service Response Time (s)' WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN 'Response Time Per Txn (s)' ELSE metric_name END metric_name, CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN ROUND((average / 100), CASE WHEN average > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN ROUND((average / 100), CASE WHEN average > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) ELSE ROUND( average, CASE WHEN average > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) END average, CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN ROUND((minval / 100), CASE WHEN minval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN ROUND((minval / 100), CASE WHEN minval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) ELSE ROUND( minval, CASE WHEN minval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) END mininum, CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN ROUND((maxval / 100), CASE WHEN maxval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN ROUND(( maxval / 100 ), CASE WHEN maxval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) ELSE ROUND( maxval, CASE WHEN maxval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) END maximum, CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN ROUND((standard_deviation / 100),2) WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN ROUND((standard_deviation / 100),2) ELSE ROUND( standard_deviation, CASE WHEN standard_deviation > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) END standard_deviation FROM sys.dba_hist_sysmetric_summary lc1 , sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn WHERE lc1.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) = :SN_TIME AND lc1.metric_name IN ('Average Active Sessions', 'SQL Service Response Time', 'Response Time Per Txn' , 'Physical Read Total Bytes Per Sec', 'DB Block Gets Per Sec', 'Consistent Read Gets Per Sec' , 'CPU Usage Per Sec', 'Host CPU Utilization (%)', 'Network Traffic Volume Per Sec') AND lc1.dbid = sn.dbid AND lc1.instance_number = sn.instance_number AND sn.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) ORDER BY lc1.metric_name

SELECT RESOURCE_NAME , CURRENT_UTILIZATION , MAX_UTILIZATION , LIMIT_VALUE FROM DBA_HIST_RESOURCE_LIMIT lc1 , sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn WHERE lc1.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) = :SN_TIME AND lc1.dbid = sn.dbid AND lc1.instance_number = sn.instance_number AND sn.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) AND CURRENT_UTILIZATION + MAX_UTILIZATION > 0 -- used resources only ORDER BY lc1.resource_name

SELECT * FROM TABLE(dbms_workload_repository.awr_report_html( ( SELECT dbid FROM v$database ), ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ), ( SELECT MAX( snap_id ) FROM dba_hist_snapshot WHERE TO_CHAR( end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) < :SN_TIME ), -- Starting snapshot ( SELECT snap_id FROM dba_hist_snapshot WHERE TO_CHAR( end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) = :SN_TIME ), -- Ending snapshot 0 -- Optionen (8 für ADDM-Bericht) ))

folder.name: SQLDevUDRepPack v0.6
folder.description:
ba6.us - SQL Developer Custom Report Library v0.6
Released 09/2017

query.sql: -- Status, Duration, SQL_ID, User, Parallel, Database Time, IO Requests, Start, Ended, SQL Text -- http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28320/dynviews_3048.htm SELECT Status, INST_ID, TO_CHAR(SQL_EXEC_START,'HH24:MI') as STARTTime, CASE WHEN Status<>'EXECUTING' THEN TO_CHAR(SQL_EXEC_START + (ELAPSED_TIME/1000000/24/60/60),'HH24:MI') WHEN Status IS NULL THEN NULL END as SQL_EXEC_END, ROUND(ELAPSED_TIME/1000000)||'s' as Duration, (SELECT USERNAME FROM V$SESSION WHERE v$SESSION.SID=mon.SID) AS USERNAME, SID, SQL_ID, SQL_PLAN_HASH_VALUE as PlanHashVal, -- Sorry, this distinct is ugly but gets the job done (SELECT DISTINCT SQL_TEXT FROM V$SQL WHERE V$SQL.SQL_ID=MON.SQL_ID) AS SQL_TEXT, KEY FROM gv$sql_monitor mon WHERE username NOT IN ('SYS','SYSTEM','DBSNMP') ORDER BY SUBSTR(STATUS,1,4) DESC, SQL_EXEC_START DESC;
select * From v$sql_plan_monitor where key = :key

WITH DataQuery as (select key, ROUND(ELAPSED_TIME/1000000,2) as ELAPSED_TIME, ROUND(USER_IO_WAIT_TIME/1000000,2) as IO_TIME, ROUND((APPLICATION_WAIT_TIME+CONCURRENCY_WAIT_TIME+CLUSTER_WAIT_TIME+PLSQL_EXEC_TIME+JAVA_EXEC_TIME)/1000000,2) as OTHER_TIME, ROUND(CPU_TIME/1000000,2) as CPU_TIME from v$sql_monitor where status <> 'EXECUTING') SELECT DATAQUERY.*, 'SQLDEV:GAUGE:0:'||(IO_TIME+OTHER_TIME+CPU_TIME)*100|| ':'||IO_TIME*100||':'||(IO_TIME+OTHER_TIME)*100||':0' as "RedIO|YellowOther|GreenCPU" FROM DataQuery

SET LONG 1000000 SET LONGCHUNKSIZE 1000000 SET LINESIZE 1000 SET PAGESIZE 0 SET TRIM ON SET TRIMSPOOL ON SET ECHO OFF SET FEEDBACK OFF
SELECT DBMS_SQLTUNE.report_sql_monitor( sql_id => :sqlid, type => 'TEXT', report_level => 'ALL') AS report FROM dual;

select s1.username || '@' || s1.machine || ' ( SID=' || s1.sid || ' ) is blocking ' || s2.username || '@' || s2.machine || ' ( SID=' || s2.sid || ' ) ' AS blocking_status from gv$lock l1, gv$session s1, gv$lock l2, gv$session s2 where s1.sid=l1.sid and s2.sid=l2.sid and sl.inst_id=s2.inst_id and l1.BLOCK=1 and l2.request > 0 and l1.id1 = l2.id1 and l1.inst_id = l2.inst_id and l2.id2 = l2.id2 and l2.inst_id = l2.inst_id

-- In Flight SQL (with SQL as CLOB, RAC Aware) SELECT SES.INST_ID, nvl(ses.username,'ORACLE PROC')||' ('||ses.sid||')' UNAM, machine, ltrim(to_char(floor(SES.LAST_CALL_ET/(3600*24)), '09'))||'d'|| ltrim(to_char(MOD(floor(SES.LAST_CALL_ET/3600),24), '09')) || 'h' || ltrim(to_char(floor(mod(SES.LAST_CALL_ET, 3600)/60), '09')) || 'm' || ltrim(to_char(mod(SES.LAST_CALL_ET, 60), '09'))||'s' "RUNT_DDHHMMSS", SQL.SQL_ID, SQL_FULLTEXT STMT, 'ALTER SYSTEM KILL SESSION ''' || SID || ',' || SERIAL# || ''';' as killstmt, ses.sql_id, osuser FROM GV$SESSION SES, GV$SQL SQL where SES.STATUS = 'ACTIVE' and SES.USERNAME is not null and SES.USERNAME <> 'CLRORBIT' and SES.SQL_ADDRESS = SQL.ADDRESS and SES.SQL_HASH_VALUE = SQL.HASH_VALUE and SES.INST_ID = SQL.INST_ID and Ses.AUDSID <> userenv('SESSIONID') order by SES.LAST_CALL_ET desc;
SELECT ROUND(sofar/totalwork*100,2), gv$session_longops.* FROM gv$session_longops WHERE sofar <> totalwork AND totalwork > 0 ORDER BY target, sid
SELECT * FROM gv$transaction_enqueue ORDER BY CTIME DESC

SELECT TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') as Time, USERNAME, OS_USERNAME, USERHOST, RETURNCODE FROM DBA_AUDIT_TRAIL WHERE --USERNAME=UPPER(:username_like_expr) AND RETURNCODE=1017 OR RETURNCODE=28001 ORDER BY TIMESTAMP DESC

SELECT USERID, NAME, USERHOST, NTIMESTAMP#, RETURNCODE, userhost FROM sys.aud$ A, AUDIT_ACTIONS AA WHERE A.ACTION#=AA.ACTION AND AA.NAME IN ('LOGON','LOGOFF') AND userid NOT IN ('DBSNMP') ORDER BY NTIMESTAMP# DESC

SELECT TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS') as Time, USERNAME, OS_USERNAME, USERHOST, ACTION_NAME, RETURNCODE, CASE RETURNCODE WHEN 0 THEN 'OK' WHEN 1017 THEN 'Wrong Username/Password' WHEN 28000 THEN 'Locked Account' WHEN 28001 THEN 'Expired Account' WHEN 28002 THEN 'Password will expire in x days' WHEN 28003 THEN 'Password verification failed' WHEN 28004 THEN 'Password verification failed' WHEN 28007 THEN 'Password cannot be reused' END as Message FROM DBA_AUDIT_TRAIL WHERE USERNAME NOT IN ('SYS','SYSTEM','DII','DBSNMP') ORDER BY TIMESTAMP DESC

display.name: AWR - Performance Detail by Snap for 1 SQL_ID

query.sql: SELECT TO_CHAR(begin_interval_time,'MM/DD/YYYY HH24:MI') || ' - ' || TO_CHAR(end_interval_time,'HH24:MI') AS INTERVAL_TEST, sql_id as SQLID, plan_hash_value AS "PlanHashValue", ROUND(elapsed_time_total/1000000,2) AS "ElapsedTotal", executions_total AS "ExecsTotal", px_servers_execs_total AS "PXServers", ROUND((elapsed_time_total/1000000)/executions_total,4) AS "ElapsedPerExec" , DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.INSTANCE_NUMBER as INST_NUM, dba_hist_sqlstat.* FROM dba_hist_sqlstat JOIN dba_hist_snapshot ON dba_hist_sqlstat.snap_id=dba_hist_snapshot.snap_id and dba_hist_sqlstat.instance_number=dba_hist_snapshot.instance_number WHERE sql_id IN (TRIM(:sql_id)) AND executions_total > 0 ORDER BY DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.end_interval_time DESC, DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.INSTANCE_NUMBER

display.name: AWR - Performance Summary By Day for 1 SQL_ID

query.sql: select TO_CHAR(TRUNC(end_interval_time),'MM/DD/YYYY HH24:MI') as Day, SQL_ID, PLAN_HASH_VALUE, ROUND(SUM(elapsed_time_total/1000000),2) as "Total Elapsed", sum(executions_total) as "TotalExecs", ROUND(SUM(elapsed_time_total/1000000)/SUM(executions_total),2) as "AvgTimePerExec", ROUND(MIN(elapsed_time_total/1000000/executions_total),2) as "MinHourlyAvgElapsed", ROUND(MAX(elapsed_time_total/1000000/executions_total),2) as "MaxHourlyAvgElapsed" from dba_hist_sqlstat join dba_hist_snapshot on dba_hist_sqlstat.snap_id=dba_hist_snapshot.snap_id where sql_id IN (:sql_id) and executions_total > 0 GROUP BY TRUNC(end_interval_time), SQL_ID, PLAN_HASH_VALUE ORDER BY 1 DESC

display.name: AWR - Longest Running User SQL - Last n Days

query.sql: SELECT * FROM ( SELECT elap_per_exec, executions_total AS exec_cnt, total_seconds, TO_CHAR(begin_interval_time,'MM-DD-YYYY HH24:MI') || '-' || TO_CHAR(end_interval_time,'HH24:MI') period, parsing_schema_name AS username, sql_id, plan_hash_value, sql_text FROM ( WITH snap AS ( SELECT /*+ MATERIALIZE */ snap_id, begin_interval_time, end_interval_time FROM dba_hist_snapshot WHERE end_interval_time > ( SYSDATE - :previous_days ) ),sql AS ( SELECT /*+ MATERIALIZE */ * FROM dba_hist_sqlstat WHERE executions_total > 0 ) SELECT round(elapsed_time_total / 1000000 / executions_total,2) AS elap_per_exec, sql.sql_id, sql.plan_hash_value, parsing_schema_name, executions_total, round(elapsed_time_total / 1000000,2) AS total_seconds, sql_text, begin_interval_time, end_interval_time FROM snap JOIN sql ON snap.snap_id = sql.snap_id JOIN dba_hist_sqltext ON sql.sql_id = dba_hist_sqltext.sql_id ) ORDER BY elap_per_exec DESC ) WHERE ROWNUM <= 5000 AND USERNAME NOT IN ('SYS','SYSTEM','DBSNMP','DII','AUDSYS')

display.name: AWR Reports By Snap - Detail as Text

query.sql: SELECT output FROM TABLE (dbms_workload_repository.awr_report_text (:DBID,:INSTANCE_NUMBER,:SNAP_ID,:SNAP_ID+1 ) )

SELECT RPAD('(' || p.ID || ' ' || NVL(p.parent_id,'0') || ')',8) || '|' || RPAD(LPAD (' ', 2*p.DEPTH) || p.operation || ' ' || p.options,80,'.') || NVL2(p.object_owner||p.object_name, '(' || p.object_owner|| '.' || p.object_name || ') ', '') || 'Cost:' || p.COST || ' ' || NVL2(p.bytes||p.CARDINALITY,'(' || p.bytes || ' bytes, ' || p.CARDINALITY || ' rows)','') || ' ' || NVL2(p.partition_id || p.partition_start || p.partition_stop,'PId:' || p.partition_id || ' PStart:' || p.partition_start || ' PStop:' || p.partition_stop,'') || 'io cost=' || p.io_cost || ',cpu_cost=' || p.cpu_cost AS PLAN FROM dba_hist_sql_plan p WHERE p.sql_id=:SQL_ID AND plan_hash_value=:PLAN_HASH_VALUE ORDER BY p.id, p.parent_id

display.name: AWR Perf Detail By Snap - RAC Comparison

query.sql: SELECT TO_CHAR(begin_interval_time,'MM/DD/YYYY HH24:MI') || ' - ' || TO_CHAR(end_interval_time,'HH24:MI') AS INTERVAL_TEST, sql_id as SQLID, plan_hash_value AS "PlanHashValue", ROUND(elapsed_time_total/1000000,2) AS "ElapsedTotal", executions_total AS "ExecsTotal", px_servers_execs_total AS "PXServers", ROUND((elapsed_time_total/1000000)/executions_total,2) AS "ElapsedPerExec" , DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.INSTANCE_NUMBER as INST_NUM, dba_hist_sqlstat.* FROM dba_hist_sqlstat JOIN dba_hist_snapshot ON dba_hist_sqlstat.snap_id=dba_hist_snapshot.snap_id and dba_hist_sqlstat.instance_number=dba_hist_snapshot.instance_number WHERE sql_id IN (TRIM(:sql_id)) AND executions_total > 0 ORDER BY INST_NUM, DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.end_interval_time DESC, DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.INSTANCE_NUMBER

display.name: AWR Plan Usage Summary for 1 SQL_ID

query.sql: WITH p AS ( SELECT plan_hash_value FROM gv$sql_plan WHERE sql_id = TRIM(:sql_id) AND other_xml IS NOT NULL UNION SELECT plan_hash_value FROM dba_hist_sql_plan WHERE sql_id = TRIM(:sql_id) AND other_xml IS NOT NULL ), m AS ( SELECT plan_hash_value, SUM(elapsed_time)/SUM(executions) avg_et_secs FROM gv$sql WHERE sql_id = TRIM(:sql_id) AND executions > 0 GROUP BY plan_hash_value ), a AS ( SELECT plan_hash_value, SUM(elapsed_time_total)/SUM(executions_total) avg_et_secs, count(*) as CNT, MIN(SNAP_ID) as MIN_SNAP_ID, MAX(SNAP_ID) as MAX_SNAP_ID FROM dba_hist_sqlstat WHERE sql_id = TRIM(:sql_id) AND executions_total > 0 GROUP BY plan_hash_value ) SELECT p.plan_hash_value, ROUND(NVL(m.avg_et_secs, a.avg_et_secs)/1e6, 3) avg_et_secs, CNT, MIN_SNAP_ID, (SELECT TO_CHAR(MAX(END_INTERVAL_TIME),'MM-DD-YYYY') FROM DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT WHERE SNAP_ID=MIN_SNAP_ID) as MIN_SNAP_END_TIME, MAX_SNAP_ID, (SELECT TO_CHAR(MAX(END_INTERVAL_TIME),'MM-DD-YYYY') FROM DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT WHERE SNAP_ID=MAX_SNAP_ID) as MAX_SNAP_END_TIME FROM p, m, a WHERE p.plan_hash_value = m.plan_hash_value(+) AND p.plan_hash_value = a.plan_hash_value(+) ORDER BY avg_et_secs NULLS LAST

display.name: Execution Plan Color Map v1
display.description:
Show summary of plan usage for each AWR period to view performance trends and identify good/bad plans.
This report searches all availabel AWR history for 1 SQL_ID.

display.name: Execution Plan Volatility
display.description:
For all AWR History available, find SQL statements that have used more than 1 PLAN_HASH_VALUE.
History: 11-19-2014 DMANN - Added SQL Text

query.sql: WITH STMTS AS ( select sql_id, count(*) AS CNT from ( select distinct sql_id, plan_hash_value from dba_hist_sqlstat) group by sql_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1 ORDER BY 2 DESC) SELECT STMTS.*,DBA_HIST_SQLTEXT.SQL_TEXT FROM STMTS LEFT OUTER JOIN DBA_HIST_SQLTEXT ON STMTS.SQL_ID=DBA_HIST_SQLTEXT.SQL_ID ORDER BY CNT DESC

display.name: AWR - Performance Detail by Snap for 1 SQL_ID - Graph by Exec Time

query.sql:
SELECT * FROM ( SELECT --TO_CHAR(begin_interval_time,'MM/DD/YYYY HH24:MI') -- || ' - ' -- || TO_CHAR(end_interval_time,'HH24:MI') AS INTERVAL_TEST, -- Y Axis begin_interval_time, -- Legend 'Elapsed Per Exec - '||SQL_ID AS Legend, -- X Axis ROUND((elapsed_time_total/1000000)/executions_total,2) AS ELAPSED_PER_EXEC
-- plan_hash_value AS "PlanHashValue", -- ROUND(elapsed_time_total/1000000,2) AS "ElapsedTotal", -- executions_total AS "ExecsTotal", -- px_servers_execs_total AS "PXServers", -- DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.INSTANCE_NUMBER as INST_NUM, -- dba_hist_sqlstat.* FROM dba_hist_sqlstat JOIN dba_hist_snapshot ON dba_hist_sqlstat.snap_id=dba_hist_snapshot.snap_id and dba_hist_sqlstat.instance_number=dba_hist_snapshot.instance_number WHERE sql_id IN (TRIM(:sql_id)) AND executions_total > 0 ORDER BY DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.end_interval_time DESC, DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.INSTANCE_NUMBER ASC) WHERE ROWNUM < 1000 ORDER BY begin_interval_time

-- Child report: -- http://www.thatjeffsmith.com/archive/2012/01/sweet-child-report-o-mine/ SELECT SNAP_ID, INSTANCE_NUMBER, TO_CHAR(BEGIN_INTERVAL_TIME,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') as BEGIN_TIME, EXTRACT( HOUR FROM (END_INTERVAL_TIME-BEGIN_INTERVAL_TIME))*60+ EXTRACT( MINUTE FROM (END_INTERVAL_TIME-BEGIN_INTERVAL_TIME)) AS MINUTES, DBID FROM dba_hist_snapshot ORDER BY SNAP_ID DESC, INSTANCE_NUMBER ASC;

display.name: AWR Reports By Snap - Detail as HTML

query.sql: SELECT output FROM TABLE (dbms_workload_repository.awr_report_html (:DBID,:INSTANCE_NUMBER,:SNAP_ID,:SNAP_ID+1 ) )

display.name: AWR - Performance Detail by Snap for 1 SQL_ID - Graph by Count

query.sql:
SELECT * FROM ( SELECT --TO_CHAR(begin_interval_time,'MM/DD/YYYY HH24:MI') -- || ' - ' -- || TO_CHAR(end_interval_time,'HH24:MI') AS INTERVAL_TEST, -- Y Axis begin_interval_time, -- Legend 'Executions per AWR Period - '||SQL_ID AS Legend, -- X Axis -- ROUND((elapsed_time_total/1000000)/executions_total,2) AS ELAPSED_PER_EXEC
-- plan_hash_value AS "PlanHashValue", -- ROUND(elapsed_time_total/1000000,2) AS "ElapsedTotal", executions_total AS "ExecsTotal" -- px_servers_execs_total AS "PXServers", -- DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.INSTANCE_NUMBER as INST_NUM, -- dba_hist_sqlstat.* FROM dba_hist_sqlstat JOIN dba_hist_snapshot ON dba_hist_sqlstat.snap_id=dba_hist_snapshot.snap_id and dba_hist_sqlstat.instance_number=dba_hist_snapshot.instance_number WHERE sql_id IN (TRIM(:sql_id)) AND executions_total > 0 ORDER BY DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.end_interval_time DESC, DBA_HIST_SNAPSHOT.INSTANCE_NUMBER ASC) WHERE ROWNUM < 1000 ORDER BY begin_interval_time

-- Historical RowCounts From Stats History WITH TableList AS (SELECT object_id, OWNER, object_name FROM dba_objects WHERE object_type='TABLE' AND object_name = UPPER(:TNAME) ) , HistTableInfo AS (SELECT TableList.OWNER, OBJECT_NAME AS TABLE_NAME, TO_CHAR(ANALYZETIME,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') AS AnalyzeTime, OTH.ROWCNT FROM SYS.WRI$_OPTSTAT_TAB_HISTORY OTH, TableList WHERE OTH.OBJ# = TableList.OBJECT_ID ), CurrTableInfo AS (SELECT TableList.OWNER, TABLE_NAME, TO_CHAR(LAST_ANALYZED,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') AS AnalyzeTime, num_rows AS ROWCNT FROM DBA_TABLES, TableList WHERE DBA_TABLES.TABLE_NAME = TableList.object_name AND DBA_TABLES.OWNER = TableList.owner) SELECT * FROM HistTableInfo UNION SELECT * FROM CurrTableInfo ORDER BY 1,2,3;

display.name: Stale User Object Statistics
display.description:
Tables with More Than 10% Change since last stats gather.
Excluded SYS use. Look up information on Fixed Object Stats if these objects need a stats run.

query.sql:
SELECT ATM.TABLE_OWNER, ATM.TABLE_NAME, ATM.PARTITION_NAME, AT.NUM_ROWS AS Analyzed_Num_Rows, ATM.INSERTS, ATM.UPDATES, ATM.DELETES, (ATM.INSERTS +ATM.UPDATES+ATM.DELETES) AS Changes, ROUND(((ATM.INSERTS+ATM.UPDATES+ATM.DELETES)/NUM_ROWS)*100,2) AS pct, (SELECT TO_CHAR(LAST_ANALYZED,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') FROM DBA_TABLES WHERE OWNER =ATM.TABLE_OWNER AND TABLE_NAME=ATM.TABLE_NAME ) AS LAST_ANALYZED FROM ALL_TAB_MODIFICATIONS ATM, ALL_TABLES AT WHERE ATM.TABLE_OWNER NOT IN ('SYS') AND ATM.TABLE_OWNER=AT.OWNER AND ATM.TABLE_NAME =AT.TABLE_NAME AND ATM.TABLE_NAME NOT LIKE 'BIN$%' --AND ATM.TABLE_OWNER NOT IN ('SYS') AND ATM.TABLE_OWNER NOT IN ('SYS','SYSTEM','SYSMAN')
AND NUM_ROWS <> 0 AND ROUND(((ATM.INSERTS+ATM.UPDATES+ATM.DELETES)/NUM_ROWS)*100,2)>= 10 ORDER BY 9 DESC

display.name: Stats Survey (Work in Progress)
display.description:
Purpose: Produce and HTML report with information about Stats Gathering configuration including defaults, jobs, exceptions to the defaults, etc.
Todo: Show information about default jobs configured for stats. Want to add info about any tables that have custom stats parameters that differ from the global defaults.

query.sql: with dependencies as ( -- top down through the heirarchy select /*+ no_merge */ referenced_type || ' "' || referenced_owner || '"."' || referenced_name || '"' as parent, type || ' "' || owner || '"."' || name || '"' as child, level hlevel, referenced_owner, referenced_name, referenced_type, owner, name, type from dba_dependencies start with referenced_owner = :uowner and referenced_name = :uobject connect by referenced_owner = prior owner and referenced_name = prior name and referenced_type = prior type union -- bottom up through the heirarchy select /*+ no_merge */ referenced_type || ' "' || referenced_owner || '"."' || referenced_name || '"' as parent, type || ' "' || owner || '"."' || name || '"' as child, level hlevel, referenced_owner, referenced_name, referenced_type, owner, name, type from dba_dependencies start with owner = :uowner and name = :uobject connect by owner = prior referenced_owner and name = prior referenced_name and type = prior referenced_type order by 1, 2 ), RESULTS AS ( select referenced_owner, referenced_name, referenced_type from dependencies d, dba_objects o where o.owner = d.owner and o.object_type = d.type and d.name = o.object_name and (d.referenced_type='TABLE') order by parent, child) SELECT --* REFERENCED_OWNER AS OWNER, REFERENCED_NAME AS TABLE_NAME, T.LAST_ANALYZED AS TABLE_LAST_ANALYZED, T.NUM_ROWS as TAB_NUM_ROWS, T.SAMPLE_SIZE as TAB_SAMP_ROWS, INDEX_NAME, I.LAST_ANALYZED AS INDEX_LAST_ANALYZED FROM RESULTS R, DBA_TABLES T, DBA_INDEXES I WHERE REFERENCED_OWNER=T.OWNER AND REFERENCED_NAME=T.TABLE_NAME AND REFERENCED_OWNER=I.OWNER (+) AND REFERENCED_NAME=I.TABLE_NAME (+)
SELECT owner, segment_name, segment_type, partition_name, ROUND(bytes/1024/1024/1024,3) as GB FROM dba_segments ORDER BY bytes desc
SELECT OWNER, TABLESPACE_NAME, ROUND(SUM(BYTES)/1024/1024/1024,3) as GB FROM DBA_SEGMENTS GROUP BY OWNER, TABLESPACE_NAME ORDER BY OWNER, TABLESPACE_NAME
SELECT OWNER, COUNT(*) as SEGMENT_COUNT, ROUND(SUM(BYTES)/1024/1024/1024,3) as SEGMENT_TOTAL_GB FROM DBA_SEGMENTS GROUP BY OWNER ORDER BY 3 DESC

WITH DiffParamsSet AS (select distinct name From gv$parameter group by name, value having count(*) =1) SELECT name, inst_id, value FROM gv$PARAMETER where name in (SELECT name from DiffParamsSet) order by name, inst_id
SELECT * FROM DBA_DATAPUMP_JOBS

with segment_rollup as ( select owner, table_name, owner segment_owner, table_name segment_name from dba_tables union all select table_owner, table_name, owner segment_owner, index_name segment_name from dba_indexes union all select owner, table_name, owner segment_owner, segment_name from dba_lobs union all select owner, table_name, owner segment_owner, index_name segment_name from dba_lobs ), ranked_tables as ( select rank() over (order by sum(blocks) desc) rank, sum(blocks) blocks, r.owner, r.table_name from segment_rollup r, dba_segments s where s.owner=r.segment_owner and s.segment_name=r.segment_name and r.owner=upper('&schema_name') group by r.owner, r.table_name ) select rank, round(blocks*8/1024) mb, table_name from ranked_tables where rank<=20

display.name: Memory Resize Operation History (Experimental)
display.description: Need to find a way to smooth out the staggered times that pool resizes happen in order to make things 'nice' on this graph.

query.sql: SELECT END_TIME, COMPONENT, TARGET_SIZE FROM DBA_HIST_MEMORY_RESIZE_OPS ORDER BY UPPER(COMPONENT), END_TIME
SELECT END_TIME, COMPONENT, TARGET_SIZE FROM DBA_HIST_MEMORY_RESIZE_OPS WHERE COMPONENT IN ('PGA Target') ORDER BY END_TIME, COMPONENT
SELECT END_TIME, COMPONENT, TARGET_SIZE FROM DBA_HIST_MEMORY_RESIZE_OPS WHERE COMPONENT IN ('SGA Target') ORDER BY END_TIME, COMPONENT

display.name: Default Buffer Pool Memory Resize Operation History

query.sql: SELECT END_TIME, COMPONENT, TARGET_SIZE FROM DBA_HIST_MEMORY_RESIZE_OPS WHERE COMPONENT IN ('DEFAULT buffer cache') ORDER BY END_TIME, COMPONENT

display.name: Archived Log Heat Map by Count

query.sql: SELECT NAME, ROUND(SPACE_LIMIT/1024/1024/1024,2) AS SPACE_LIMIT_GB, ROUND(SPACE_USED/1024/1024/1024,2) AS SPACE_USED_GB, ROUND(SPACE_RECLAIMABLE/1024/1024/1024,2) AS SPACE_RECLAIMABLE_GB, RFD.* FROM V$RECOVERY_FILE_DEST RFD

WITH AllLogs AS ( SELECT GROUP#, THREAD#, SEQUENCE#, BYTES, BLOCKSIZE, ARCHIVED, STATUS, FIRST_CHANGE#, FIRST_TIME, NEXT_CHANGE#, NEXT_TIME --MEMBERS, FROM V$LOG UNION ALL SELECT GROUP#, THREAD#, SEQUENCE#, BYTES, BLOCKSIZE, ARCHIVED, STATUS, FIRST_CHANGE#, FIRST_TIME, NEXT_CHANGE#, NEXT_TIME --DBID VARCHAR2(40) --USED, --LAST_CHANGE# NUMBER --LAST_TIME DATE FROM V$STANDBY_LOG) SELECT AllLogs.GROUP#, AllLogs.THREAD#, SEQUENCE#, BYTES, ARCHIVED, AllLogs.STATUS, V$LOGFILE.TYPE, MEMBER FROM AllLogs, V$LOGFILE WHERE AllLogs.GROUP#=V$LOGFILE.GROUP# ORDER BY GROUP#
select * from v$log

-- Redo Log Daily Summary SELECT TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME,'DD') DAY, thread#, ROUND(SUM(BLOCKS*BLOCK_SIZE)/1048576) MB, COUNT( *) Archives_Generated FROM v$archived_log WHERE TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME) < TRUNC(SYSDATE) GROUP BY TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME,'DD'), thread# ORDER BY 1 DESC;

-- Redo Log Hourly Summary SELECT TO_CHAR(TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME,'HH'),'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') Hour, THREAD# , ROUND(SUM(BLOCKS*BLOCK_SIZE)/(1024*1024)) TOTAL_FILE_MB, COUNT(*) NUM_LOGS, MIN(SEQUENCE#), MAX(SEQUENCE#) FROM v$archived_log GROUP BY TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME,'HH'), THREAD# ORDER BY 1 DESC ;

WITH OwnerList AS (SELECT DISTINCT OWNER FROM DBA_TABLES), TableList AS (SELECT OWNER, TABLE_NAME FROM DBA_TABLES WHERE LOGGING='NO'), IndexList AS (SELECT OWNER, INDEX_NAME FROM DBA_INDEXES WHERE LOGGING='NO') SELECT OwnerList.OWNER, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM TableList WHERE OWNER=OwnerList.OWNER) AS NOLOG_TABLE_COUNT, (SELECT ROUND(SUM(BYTES)/1024/1024/1024,2) FROM DBA_SEGMENTS, TableList WHERE DBA_SEGMENTS.OWNER=OwnerList.OWNER AND DBA_SEGMENTS.SEGMENT_NAME = TableList.TABLE_NAME) as NOLOG_TABLE_SIZE_GB, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM IndexList WHERE OWNER=OwnerList.OWNER) AS NOLOG_INDEX_COUNT, (SELECT ROUND(SUM(BYTES)/1024/1024/1024,2) FROM DBA_SEGMENTS, IndexList WHERE DBA_SEGMENTS.OWNER=OwnerList.OWNER AND DBA_SEGMENTS.SEGMENT_NAME = IndexList.INDEX_NAME) as NOLOG_INDEX_SIZE_GB FROM OWNERLIST

select name, floor(space_limit/1024/1024) "Size_MB", ceil(space_used/1024/1024) "Used_MB", floor(space_limit/1024/1024) - ceil(space_used/1024/1024) "Available_MB", round(ceil(space_used/1024/1024) / floor(space_limit/1024/1024) * 100) || '%' "Percent Used" from v$recovery_file_dest order by name

select TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') TIMESTAMP, TO_CHAR(completion_time,'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') "ArchTime", SEQUENCE#,round((blocks*block_size)/(1024*1024),1) "SizeM", round((TIMESTAMP-lag(TIMESTAMP,1,TIMESTAMP) OVER (order by TIMESTAMP))*24*60*60,1) "Diff(sec)", round((blocks*block_size)/1024/ decode(((TIMESTAMP-lag(TIMESTAMP,1,TIMESTAMP) OVER (order by TIMESTAMP))*24*60*60),0,1, (TIMESTAMP-lag(TIMESTAMP,1,TIMESTAMP) OVER (order by TIMESTAMP))*24*60*60),1) "KB/sec", round((blocks*block_size)/(1024*1024)/ decode(((TIMESTAMP-lag(TIMESTAMP,1,TIMESTAMP) OVER (order by TIMESTAMP))*24*60*60),0,1, (TIMESTAMP-lag(TIMESTAMP,1,TIMESTAMP) OVER (order by TIMESTAMP))*24*60*60),3) "MB/sec", round(((lead(TIMESTAMP,1,TIMESTAMP) over (order by TIMESTAMP))-completion_time)*24*60*60,1) "Lag(sec)" from v$archived_log a, v$dataguard_status dgs where a.name = replace(dgs.MESSAGE,'Media Recovery Log ','') and dgs.FACILITY = 'Log Apply Services' order by TIMESTAMP desc

select THREAD#, (select max(sequence#) "Last Standby Seq Received" from v$archived_log val, v$database vdb where val.resetlogs_change# = vdb.resetlogs_change# AND THREAD#=gv$instance.THREAD# group by thread#) as LAST_SEQ_RECEIVED, (select max(sequence#) "Last Standby Seq Applied" from v$archived_log val, v$database vdb where val.resetlogs_change# = vdb.resetlogs_change# and val.applied in ('YES','IN-MEMORY') AND THREAD#=gv$instance.THREAD# group by thread#) as LAST_SEQ_APPLIED From gv$instance
SELECT TO_CHAR(scn_to_timestamp((select current_scn from v$database)),'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') AS CURRENT_SCN_TO_TIMESTAMP FROM DUAL

display.name: Redo Log - Daily Average Across All Instances Past 30 Days

query.sql: -- Redo Log Daily Summary SELECT TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME,'DD') DAY, COUNT( *) Archives_Generated_Count, ROUND(SUM(BLOCKS*BLOCK_SIZE)/1048576/1024) TOTAL_GB FROM v$archived_log WHERE TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME) < TRUNC(SYSDATE) AND TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME) > TRUNC(SYSDATE-31) GROUP BY TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME,'DD') ORDER BY 1 DESC;

display.name: Archived Log Heat Map by Hourly and Daily Redo GB

query.sql: -- Archived Log History Summary SELECT THREAD#, TRUNC(FIRST_TIME) AS GroupDate, MIN(SEQUENCE#) AS FirstSeq, MAX(SEQUENCE#) AS LastSeq, MAX(SEQUENCE#)-MIN(SEQUENCE#) AS LogsPerDay, ROUND(SUM(BLOCKS*BLOCK_SIZE)/1024/1024) as mb FROM v$archived_log GROUP BY THREAD#, TRUNC(FIRST_TIME) ORDER BY 1,2 DESC;

-- Redo Log Daily Summary SELECT TO_CHAR(TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME),'YYYY-MM-DD') Day, THREAD# , ROUND(SUM(BLOCKS*BLOCK_SIZE)/(1024*1024)) TOTAL_FILE_MB, COUNT(*) NUM_LOGS, MIN(SEQUENCE#), MAX(SEQUENCE#) FROM v$archived_log GROUP BY TRUNC(COMPLETION_TIME), THREAD# ORDER BY 1 DESC ;
select path,TOTAL_MB,FREE_MB from v$asm_disk
select name, type, total_mb, free_mb, required_mirror_free_mb, usable_file_mb from v$asm_diskgroup

display.name: ASM - Disk Configured on Raw Devices

query.sql: select disk_number,mount_status,header_status,mode_status,state,path from v$asm_disk where path like '%rdisk%' or path like '%raw%'
SELECT * FROM v$asm_file JOIN v$asm_diskgroup on v$asm_file.group_number=v$asm_diskgroup.group_number WHERE v$ASM_DISKGROUP.NAME = UPPER(TRIM(:DGNAME)) ORDER BY 4 DESC
select * From APEX_040200.WWV_FLOW_FND_USER
SELECT input_bytes_display, output_bytes_display, status, time_taken_display, det.* FROM V$RMAN_BACKUP_JOB_DETAILS det --WHERE TRUNC(START_TIME) > (TRUNC(SYSDATE)-1) ORDER BY START_TIME DESC

SELECT 'DUPLICATE/RESTORE THROUGHPUT', round(SUM(v.value/1024/1024),1) mbytes_sofar, round(SUM(v.value /1024/1024)/nvl((SELECT MIN(elapsed_seconds) FROM v$session_longops WHERE OPNAME LIKE 'RMAN: aggregate input' AND SOFAR != TOTALWORK AND elapsed_seconds IS NOT NULL ),SUM(v.value /1024/1024)),2) mbytes_per_sec, n.name FROM gv$sesstat v, v$statname n, gv$session s WHERE v.statistic#=n.statistic# AND n.name = 'physical write total bytes' AND v.sid = s.sid AND v.inst_id=s.inst_id AND s.program like 'rman@%' GROUP BY 'DUPLICATE/RESTORE THROUGHPUT',n.name

SELECT det.START_TIME, det.END_TIME, status, time_taken_display, ROUND(OUTPUT_BYTES/1024/1024) as OUTPUT_MB, ROUND(((END_TIME-START_TIME)*(24*60*60))) as RUN_SECONDS, ROUND(OUTPUT_BYTES_PER_SEC/1024/1024,2) as OUTPUT_MB_PER_SEC FROM V$RMAN_BACKUP_JOB_DETAILS det WHERE STATUS <> 'FAILED' ORDER BY START_TIME DESC
SELECT input_bytes_display, output_bytes_display, status, time_taken_display, det.* FROM V$RMAN_BACKUP_JOB_DETAILS det WHERE STATUS='RUNNING' ORDER BY START_TIME DESC

display.name: Idle Sessions with Locks (2 hours or older)

query.sql: -- Idle Session Lock Summary WITH LOCKSUMMARY AS (select INST_ID, SESSION_ID AS SID,COUNT(*) as LOCKED_OBJECT_COUNT FROM gv$locked_object GROUP BY INST_ID, SESSION_ID) select gv$session.sid, gv$session.inst_id, LAST_CALL_ET, LOCKED_OBJECT_COUNT from gv$session JOIN locksummary ls ON gv$session.sid=ls.sid AND gv$session.inst_id=ls.inst_id where status='INACTIVE' AND last_call_et > 7200 order by last_call_et DESC;

SELECT gvh.SID sessid, gvs.serial# serial, gvh.inst_id instance_id, gvs.* FROM gv$lock gvh, gv$lock gvw, gv$session gvs WHERE (gvh.id1, gvh.id2) IN (SELECT id1, id2 FROM gv$lock WHERE request = 0 INTERSECT SELECT id1, id2 FROM gv$lock WHERE lmode = 0 ) AND gvh.id1 = gvw.id1 AND gvh.id2 = gvw.id2 AND gvh.request = 0 AND gvw.lmode = 0 AND gvh.SID = gvs.SID AND gvh.inst_id = gvs.inst_id

display.name: Idle Session Locked Object Detail (2 hours+)

query.sql: SELECT gv$session.sid, gv$session.inst_id, username, osuser, machine, LAST_CALL_ET as SECS_SINCE_LAST_CALL, ROUND(LAST_CALL_ET/3600,1) as HRS_SINCE_LAST_CALL, lo.object_id, (SELECT owner||'.'||object_name FROM dba_objects WHERE object_id=lo.object_id) AS OBJECT_NAME FROM gv$session JOIN gv$locked_object lo ON gv$session.sid =lo.session_id AND gv$session.inst_id=lo.inst_id WHERE status ='INACTIVE' AND last_call_et > 7200 ORDER BY last_call_et DESC

select s1.username || '@' || s1.machine || ' ( INST_ID='||s1.INST_ID||' SID=' || s1.sid || ' ) is blocking ' || s2.username || '@' || s2.machine || ' ( INST_ID= '||s2.INST_ID||' SID=' || s2.sid || ' ) ' AS blocking_status from gv$lock l1, gv$session s1, gv$lock l2, gv$session s2 where (s1.sid=l1.sid and s1.INST_ID=l1.INST_ID) and (s2.sid=l2.sid and s2.INST_ID=l2.INST_ID) and l1.BLOCK=1 and l2.request > 0 and (l1.id1 = l2.id1) and l1.id2 = l2.id2

select lpad(' ', 2*level) || granted_role "User, his roles and privileges" from ( /* THE USERS */ select null grantee, username granted_role from dba_users where username=UPPER(:username) /* THE ROLES TO ROLES RELATIONS */ union select grantee, granted_role from dba_role_privs /* THE ROLES TO PRIVILEGE RELATIONS */ union select grantee, privilege from dba_sys_privs ) start with grantee is null connect by grantee = prior granted_role
select * from gv$pwfile_users

display.name: Killed 9i users that need OS process killed

query.sql: SELECT s.status, s.sid, s.serial#, p.spid, s.username, s.program, 'kill -9 '||p.spid as killstmt FROM v$session s JOIN v$process p ON p.addr = s.paddr WHERE status in ('KILLED')

-- Here is the SQL to find Blocking locks in Oracle 9i r2 which is what we used in the procs above SELECT vs.sid, vs.username, vs.logon_time, vs.machine, vs.sql_hash_value, vsql.piece, vsql.sql_text, vs.prev_hash_value FROM V$SESSION vs, v$sqltext vsql WHERE SID IN ( SELECT lpad(' ',DECODE(vl.request,0,0,1))||sid FROM V$LOCK vl WHERE id1 IN ( SELECT id1 FROM V$LOCK vl2 WHERE vl2.lmode = 0) ) AND vs.sql_hash_value = vsql.hash_value ORDER BY 2,5,6;

SELECT f.tablespace_name tname, round(SUM(ROUND((f.bytes_free + f.bytes_used) / 1024 / 1024, 2)),0) allocated_mb, round(SUM(ROUND(nvl(p.bytes_used, 0) / 1024 / 1024, 2)),0) Used_MB, round(SUM(ROUND(((f.bytes_free + f.bytes_used) - nvl(p.bytes_used, 0)) / 1024 / 1024, 2)),0) Free_MB, round((SUM(ROUND(nvl(p.bytes_used, 0) / 1024 / 1024, 2)) * 100) / (SUM(ROUND((f.bytes_free + f.bytes_used) / 1024 / 1024, 2))),2) "USED (%)", (100-round((SUM(ROUND(nvl(p.bytes_used, 0)/1024/1024, 2)) * 100) / (SUM(ROUND((f.bytes_free + f.bytes_used)/1024/ 1024, 2))),2)) "FREE (%)", round(SUM(maxbytes / 1024 / 1024),0) maxsize_mb, d.file_name file_name FROM sys.v_$temp_space_header f, dba_temp_files d, sys.v_$temp_extent_pool p WHERE f.tablespace_name(+) = d.tablespace_name AND f.file_id(+) = d.file_id AND p.file_id(+) = d.file_id GROUP BY f.tablespace_name, file_name ORDER BY 5 DESC

folder.name: ASH
folder.description: ASH Related Queries Note: ASH data can and will expire!

display.name: Users Logged In During Time Period

query.sql: SELECT user_id, to_char(SAMPLE_TIME,'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi:ss') from gv$active_session_history where SAMPLE_TIME between to_date(:start_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi') and to_date(:end_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi')

display.name: SQLs Using Temp Space > 1GB over past 48 Hours

query.sql: -- Temp space consumers > 1 GB in past 48 hours select sql_id,max(TEMP_SPACE_ALLOCATED)/(1024*1024*1024) gig from DBA_HIST_ACTIVE_SESS_HISTORY where sample_time > sysdate-2 and TEMP_SPACE_ALLOCATED > (1*1024*1024*1024) group by sql_id order by sql_id;

select sid, serial#, username, osuser, machine, module, LAST_CALL_ET, ROUND(LAST_CALL_ET/3600/24,2) AS DAYS, (SELECT DISTINCT SQL_TEXT FROM V$SQL WHERE SQL_ID=PREV_SQL_ID) as SQL_TEXT, 'alter system kill session '''||sid||','||serial#||''';' as sql from v$session where last_call_et > (1*24*3600) and STATUS='INACTIVE' and USERNAME NOT IN ('SYS','SYSTEM') ORDER BY LAST_CALL_ET

display.name: Sessions By Last Call ET in Days

query.sql: SELECT INST_ID, USERNAME, DAYS_INACTIVE, COUNT(*) SESSION_COUNT FROM (select INST_ID, USERNAME, osuser, machine, last_call_et, ROUND(last_call_et/24/60/60) as days_inactive, status From gv$session where osuser NOT IN ('oracle') order by last_call_et desc) GROUP BY INST_ID, USERNAME, DAYS_INACTIVE ORDER BY INST_ID, DAYS_INACTIVE

display.name: Sessions by Last Call ET - Graph

query.sql: SELECT --USERNAME, DAYS_INACTIVE, COUNT(*) SESSION_COUNT FROM ( select USERNAME, osuser, machine, last_call_et, ROUND(last_call_et/24/60/60) as days_inactive, status From gv$session where osuser NOT IN ('oracle') order by last_call_et desc) GROUP BY DAYS_INACTIVE ORDER BY DAYS_INACTIVE

select s.username, s.sid, s.serial#, s.logon_time, s.last_call_et, p.spid as UNIX_PROCESS_ID, 'kill -9 '||p.SPID as UnixKillStmt FROM v$session s, v$process p WHERE S.PADDR=P.ADDR AND S.STATUS='KILLED' ORDER BY S.LAST_CALL_ET DESC

-- What SQL Statements/Sessions are using the most TEMP on a RAC Database? SELECT u.INST_ID, s.sid sid, s.username, a.sql_id, a.plan_hash_value, ROUND(((u.blocks*p.value)/1024/1024),2) size_mb, u.tablespace, a.sql_text FROM gv$sort_usage u, gv$session s, gv$sqlarea a, gv$parameter p WHERE s.saddr = u.session_addr AND s.INST_ID =u.INST_ID AND a.address (+) = s.sql_address AND a.hash_value (+) = s.sql_hash_value AND a.INST_ID (+) = s.INST_ID AND p.name = 'db_block_size' AND p.INST_ID =u.INST_ID AND s.username != 'SYSTEM' GROUP BY u.INST_ID, s.sid, s.username, a.sql_id, a.plan_hash_value, a.sql_text, u.tablespace, ROUND(((u.blocks *p.value)/1024/1024),2) HAVING ROUND(((u.blocks *p.value)/1024/1024),2) > 10 ORDER BY ROUND(((u.blocks*p.value)/1024/1024),2) DESC;

-- Min, Max, Low Thresh, Upper Thresh, Value select inst_id, count(*), 'SQLDEV:GAUGE:0:'|| (select value from v$parameter where name='sessions')||':'|| (select ROUND(value*0.80) from v$parameter where name='sessions')||':'|| (select ROUND(value*0.90) from v$parameter where name='sessions')||':'|| COUNT(*) as "Gauge " from gv$session group by inst_id order by inst_id

display.name: Idle Session Detail - by LAST_CALL_ET DESC

query.sql: select inst_id, sid, serial#, username, osuser, machine, module, LAST_CALL_ET, ROUND(LAST_CALL_ET/3600/24,2) AS DAYS, (SELECT DISTINCT SQL_TEXT FROM V$SQL WHERE SQL_ID=PREV_SQL_ID) as SQL_TEXT, 'alter system kill session '''||sid||','||serial#||''';' as sql from gv$session where STATUS='INACTIVE' and USERNAME NOT IN ('SYS','SYSTEM') ORDER BY LAST_CALL_ET ASC

-- PGA Memory in Use for Sessions SELECT s.inst_id, s.sid, s.username, s.logon_time, s.program, ROUND(PGA_USED_MEM /1024/1024,1) PGA_USED_MEM_MB, ROUND(PGA_ALLOC_MEM/1024/1024,1) PGA_ALLOC_MEM_MB FROM gv$session s , gv$process p WHERE s.paddr = p.addr AND s.inst_id = p.inst_id ORDER BY PGA_USED_MEM DESC;

-- PGA Memory in Use for Sessions SELECT s.inst_id, ROUND(SUM(PGA_USED_MEM) /1024/1024,1) PGA_USED_MEM_MB, ROUND(SUM(PGA_ALLOC_MEM) /1024/1024,1) PGA_ALLOC_MEM_MB FROM gv$session s , gv$process p WHERE s.paddr = p.addr AND s.inst_id = p.inst_id GROUP BY s.INST_ID ORDER BY s.INST_ID;

-- DB Size Allocated History SELECT DISTINCT MGMT_METRICS.TARGET_TYPE, MGMT_METRICS.TYPE_META_VER, MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_NAME, MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_COLUMN, MGMT_METRICS.SHORT_NAME, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.TARGET_GUID, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.METRIC_GUID, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.KEY_VALUE, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.ROLLUP_TIMESTAMP, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.SAMPLE_COUNT, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.VALUE_AVERAGE, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.VALUE_MINIMUM, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.VALUE_MAXIMUM, MGMT_TARGETS.TARGET_NAME FROM MGMT_METRICS, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY, MGMT_TARGETS, MGMT_TARGET_TYPES WHERE MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_GUID = MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.METRIC_GUID AND MGMT_METRICS.TARGET_TYPE = MGMT_TARGETS.TARGET_TYPE AND MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.TARGET_GUID = MGMT_TARGETS.TARGET_GUID AND MGMT_METRICS.TYPE_META_VER = MGMT_TARGETS.TYPE_META_VER AND MGMT_METRICS.TARGET_TYPE = MGMT_TARGET_TYPES.TARGET_TYPE AND (MGMT_METRICS.TARGET_TYPE = 'oracle_database') AND -- (MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.ROLLUP_TIMESTAMP > TO_DATE('2015-JAN-01', 'YYYY-MON-DD')) AND (MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_COLUMN = 'ALLOCATED_GB') AND (MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_NAME = 'DATABASE_SIZE') AND UPPER(MGMT_TARGETS.TARGET_NAME)=:DB_NAME ORDER BY MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.ROLLUP_TIMESTAMP ASC, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.SAMPLE_COUNT ASC;

display.name: OEM - DB Allocated Size History Chart

query.sql: -- DB Size Allocated History SELECT DISTINCT MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.ROLLUP_TIMESTAMP, MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_NAME, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.VALUE_AVERAGE FROM MGMT_METRICS, MGMT_METRICS_1DAY, MGMT_TARGETS, MGMT_TARGET_TYPES WHERE MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_GUID = MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.METRIC_GUID AND MGMT_METRICS.TARGET_TYPE = MGMT_TARGETS.TARGET_TYPE AND MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.TARGET_GUID = MGMT_TARGETS.TARGET_GUID AND MGMT_METRICS.TYPE_META_VER = MGMT_TARGETS.TYPE_META_VER AND MGMT_METRICS.TARGET_TYPE = MGMT_TARGET_TYPES.TARGET_TYPE AND (MGMT_METRICS.TARGET_TYPE = 'oracle_database') AND -- (MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.ROLLUP_TIMESTAMP > TO_DATE('2015-JAN-01', 'YYYY-MON-DD')) AND (MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_COLUMN = 'ALLOCATED_GB') AND (MGMT_METRICS.METRIC_NAME = 'DATABASE_SIZE') AND UPPER(MGMT_TARGETS.TARGET_NAME)=:DB_NAME ORDER BY MGMT_METRICS_1DAY.ROLLUP_TIMESTAMP

display.name: ASM Diskgroup Summary
display.description:
Original Query From : http://cloudcontrol12c.blogspot.com/2013/06/em12c-asm-storage-report.html
Note: Multiple nulls means agent is probably not online or configured correctly.

query.sql: SELECT target_name, diskgroup, MAX (DECODE (seq, 7, VALUE)) REDUNDANCY, MAX (DECODE (seq, 4, VALUE)) PERCENT_USED, MAX (DECODE (seq, 6, ceil(VALUE/1024))) TOTAL_GB, MAX (DECODE (seq, 9, ceil(VALUE/1024))) USABLE_TOTAL_GB, MAX (DECODE (seq, 3, ceil(VALUE/1024))) FREE_GB, MAX (DECODE (seq, 8, ceil(VALUE/1024))) USABLE_FREE_GB, MAX (DECODE (seq, 2, VALUE)) NO_OF_DISK, ceil(( MAX (DECODE (seq, 6, ceil(VALUE/1024)))) /(MAX (DECODE (seq, 2, VALUE)))) LUN_SIZE, MAX (DECODE (seq, 5, decode(VALUE,'No','',value))) REBAL_PENDING, MAX (DECODE (seq, 1, VALUE)) IMBALANCE FROM (SELECT target_name, key_value diskgroup, VALUE, metric_column, ROW_NUMBER () OVER (PARTITION BY target_name, key_value ORDER BY metric_column) AS seq FROM MGMT$METRIC_CURRENT WHERE target_type in ('osm_instance','osm_cluster') AND metric_column IN ('rebalInProgress', 'free_mb', 'usable_file_mb', 'type', 'computedImbalance', 'usable_total_mb', 'percent_used','diskCnt') OR ( metric_column = 'total_mb' AND metric_name = 'DiskGroup_Usage')) GROUP BY target_name, diskgroup order by 1,2

-- Monitored ASM targets with diskgroups and configured amount of space SELECT TARGET_NAME, TARGET_TYPE, METRIC_COLUMN, KEY_VALUE as ASM_DG_NAME, VALUE AS USABLE_FREE_MB FROM MGMT$METRIC_CURRENT WHERE target_type in ('osm_instance','osm_cluster') AND METRIC_COLUMN IN ('usable_file_mb','free_mbxxx') ORDER BY TARGET_NAME, TARGET_TYPE, KEY_VALUE, METRIC_COLUMN;
SELECT * FROM EMP

display.name: SQLDev4 + d3JS Example
display.description: select (SELECT ENAME FROM EMP WHERE EMPNO=E.MGR) AS MGR_ENAME, ENAME From EMP E WHERE MGR IS NOT NULL

query.sql: SELECT * FROM EMP WHERE SAL < :SAL_LIMIT

display.name: Bind Test - All Option with Null (Logic)

query.sql: select TABLESPACE_NAME "Tablespace", BLOCK_SIZE "Block_Size", INITIAL_EXTENT "Initial_Extent", NEXT_EXTENT "Next_Extent", MIN_EXTENTS "Minimum_Extents", MAX_EXTENTS "Maximum_Extents", PCT_INCREASE "Percent_Increase", MIN_EXTLEN "Minimum_Extent_Length", STATUS "Status", CONTENTS "Contents", LOGGING "Logging", FORCE_LOGGING "Force_Logging", EXTENT_MANAGEMENT "Extent_Management", ALLOCATION_TYPE "Allocation_Type", PLUGGED_IN "Plugged_In", SEGMENT_SPACE_MANAGEMENT "Segment_Space_Management" from sys.dba_tablespaces where (:TABLESPACE_NAME is null or instr(lower(tablespace_name),lower(:TABLESPACE_NAME)) > 0) order by 1

bind.tooltip: Name or part of name to search for (case insensitive).

query.sql: select TABLESPACE_NAME "Tablespace", BLOCK_SIZE "Block_Size", INITIAL_EXTENT "Initial_Extent", NEXT_EXTENT "Next_Extent", MIN_EXTENTS "Minimum_Extents", MAX_EXTENTS "Maximum_Extents", PCT_INCREASE "Percent_Increase", MIN_EXTLEN "Minimum_Extent_Length", STATUS "Status", CONTENTS "Contents", LOGGING "Logging", FORCE_LOGGING "Force_Logging", EXTENT_MANAGEMENT "Extent_Management", ALLOCATION_TYPE "Allocation_Type", PLUGGED_IN "Plugged_In", SEGMENT_SPACE_MANAGEMENT "Segment_Space_Management", DEF_TAB_COMPRESSION "Default_Tab_Compression", RETENTION "Retention", BIGFILE "Big File" from sys.dba_tablespaces where (:TABLESPACE_NAME is null or instr(lower(tablespace_name),lower(:TABLESPACE_NAME)) > 0) order by 1

bind.tooltip: Name or part of name to search for (case insensitive).

display.name: Bind Test - All Option with Null (Case)

query.sql: select TABLESPACE_NAME "Tablespace", BLOCK_SIZE "Block_Size", INITIAL_EXTENT "Initial_Extent", NEXT_EXTENT "Next_Extent", MIN_EXTENTS "Minimum_Extents", MAX_EXTENTS "Maximum_Extents", PCT_INCREASE "Percent_Increase", MIN_EXTLEN "Minimum_Extent_Length", STATUS "Status", CONTENTS "Contents", LOGGING "Logging", FORCE_LOGGING "Force_Logging", EXTENT_MANAGEMENT "Extent_Management", ALLOCATION_TYPE "Allocation_Type", PLUGGED_IN "Plugged_In", SEGMENT_SPACE_MANAGEMENT "Segment_Space_Management" from sys.dba_tablespaces where (:TABLESPACE_NAME is null or instr(lower(tablespace_name),lower(:TABLESPACE_NAME)) > 0) order by 1

bind.tooltip: Name or part of name to search for (case insensitive).

query.sql: select TABLESPACE_NAME "Tablespace", BLOCK_SIZE "Block_Size", INITIAL_EXTENT "Initial_Extent", NEXT_EXTENT "Next_Extent", MIN_EXTENTS "Minimum_Extents", MAX_EXTENTS "Maximum_Extents", PCT_INCREASE "Percent_Increase", MIN_EXTLEN "Minimum_Extent_Length", STATUS "Status", CONTENTS "Contents", LOGGING "Logging", FORCE_LOGGING "Force_Logging", EXTENT_MANAGEMENT "Extent_Management", ALLOCATION_TYPE "Allocation_Type", PLUGGED_IN "Plugged_In", SEGMENT_SPACE_MANAGEMENT "Segment_Space_Management", DEF_TAB_COMPRESSION "Default_Tab_Compression", RETENTION "Retention", BIGFILE "Big File" from sys.dba_tablespaces where CASE WHEN :TABLESPACE_NAME is null THEN 1 WHEN (instr(lower(tablespace_name),lower(:TABLESPACE_NAME)) > 0) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END = 1 order by 1

bind.tooltip: Name or part of name to search for (case insensitive).

query.sql: SELECT DNAME, DNAME, COUNT(*) --DEPT.DEPTNO FROM DEPT JOIN EMP ON DEPT.DEPTNO=EMP.DEPTNO GROUP BY DNAME
SELECT * FROM EMP WHERE DEPTNO IN (SELECT DEPTNO FROM DEPT WHERE DNAME=:DNAME)
SELECT * FROM DEPT ORDER BY DEPTNO
SELECT * FROM EMP WHERE DEPTNO=:DEPTNO
SELECT NULL AS DEPTNO, 'ALL' AS DNAME,'ALL' AS LOC FROM DUAL UNION ALL SELECT * FROM DEPT ORDER BY DEPTNO NULLS FIRST
SELECT * FROM EMP WHERE CASE WHEN DEPTNO=:DEPTNO THEN 1 WHEN :DEPTNO IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END = 1 ORDER BY ENAME

display.name: PL/SQL DBMS Output - Parameter Passing Example
PLSQL/DBMS Output - Capabilities
display.description: What are the capabilities of the built-in rendering engine?

query.sql:
SELECT '

This is red text with CSS styling

' as text from dual union all SELECT 'This is red text with Font tag' from dual union all SELECT '

'|| 'This is blue Verdana family text at 18pt with CSS styling

' from dual union all SELECT '
This is preformatted text with PRE tag
' from dual union all SELECT '' FROM DUAL union all SELECT '
  • Item 1
  • Item 2
' FROM DUAL
select * From weight order by 1,2

-- Category Group / Series / Data Value
select deptno, ename, sal from emp order by 1

-- Category Group / Series / Data Value
select deptno, ename, sal from emp order by 1

-- Category Group / Series / Data Value
select null, ename, sal from emp order by 1
-- Category Group / Series / Data Value select ename, 'Dollars Per Month', sal from emp order by 1
SELECT * FROM DEPT
SELECT * FROM EMP WHERE DEPTNO=:DEPTNO
SELECT * FROM EMP WHERE DEPTNO=:DEPTNO
select DNAME, 'Employee Count', COUNT(*), dept.DEPTNO FROM dept join emp on dept.deptno=emp.deptno group by DName, dept.DEPTNO ORDER BY 1

-- SQLDEV:GAUGE:min:max:low threshold:upper threshold:value to graph SELECT 'SQLDEV:GAUGE:0:100:33:66:50' as MY_GAUGE____________, '0:100:33:66:50' AS CONFIG FROM DUAL UNION ALL SELECT 'SQLDEV:GAUGE:0:100:80:90:50' as MY_GAUGE____________, '0:100:80:90:50' AS CONFIG FROM DUAL UNION ALL SELECT 'SQLDEV:GAUGE:0:100:100:100:50' as MY_GAUGE____________, '0:100:100:100:50' AS CONFIG FROM DUAL UNION ALL SELECT 'SQLDEV:GAUGE:0:100:0:100:50' as MY_GAUGE____________, '0:100:0:100:50' AS CONFIG FROM DUAL UNION ALL SELECT 'SQLDEV:GAUGE:0:100:0:0:50' as MY_GAUGE____________, '0:100:0:0:50' AS CONFIG FROM DUAL
SELECT ENAME, SAL, 'SQLDEV:GAUGE:0:5000:4000:4500:'||SAL AS "Salary Graph " FROM EMP ORDER BY SAL DESC

display.name: ASH Report For The Past 30 Minutes
Diag Pack Acknowledgement
